@aselle @lukaszkaiser For the L_p-path regularizer as a standalone module, the Eigen kernel can be small and quite readable, similar to this https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/kernels/l2loss_op.h
I think we can write the Path-SGD in Python for now, let people play with it, and if it shows promise, consider a C++ kernel?
As far as the LineSearch, it is unlike any other optimizer, in fact, it may need a new base class altogether, with a virtual StepDirection function, so maybe, for something this ambitious, C++ kernels would be the way to go.
